title: Business & Finance
text:
The NFL is on the verge of signing new rights deals that could see Amazon carry many games exclusively and TV networks pay as much as double their current rate.

---

Las Vegas Sands agreed to sell its Las Vegas properties to Apollo and a real-estate investment trust for about $6.25 billion.

---

Greensill plans to file for insolvency in the U.K. this week, as it simultaneously moves toward a deal to sell its operating business to Apollo.

---

The Nasdaq slid 2.7%, while the S&P 500 and Dow lost 1.3% and 0.4%, respectively. Government-bond yields ticked higher.

---

Exxon says the time has come to turn capturing carbon emissions into a real business, as it faces pressure to become a greener company.

---

Former Disney executive Kevin Mayer was named chairman of sports-streaming platform DAZN.

---

The CEO of Stellantis said he is open to dropping the Cherokee name from Jeep vehicles.

---

Okta agreed to buy Auth0, a software provider that helps businesses manage customers online, for $6.5 billion in stock.

---

Michaels Cos. is going private in a leveraged buyout by Apollo that values the company at $3.3 billion.
